title: As clock ticks on Amazon’s constellation, buying Starship launches not out of the question
summary: Amazon VP Dave Limp said the availability of heavy-lift rockets to deploy Project Kuiper satellites is “a constrained resource."

title: NASA's InSight Lander Detects Stunning Meteoroid Impact on Mars
summary: The agency’s lander felt the ground shake during the impact while cameras aboard the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter spotted the yawning new crater from space.

title: Falcon 9 set to launch Starlink Group 4-31 from Vandenberg
summary: SpaceX’s 49th Falcon 9 flight of 2022 is ready to lift off from SLC-4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base, California with 53 Starlink satellites. The launch is scheduled for Thursday, Oct. 27 at 6:14 PM PDT (01:14 UTC on Friday, Oct. 28). Falcon 9 will be launching to the southeast into a 53.2-degree inclined orbit to help fill out the fourth shell of Starlink satellites orbiting at 540 kilometers in altitude.

title: Russia threatens a retaliatory strike against US commercial satellites
summary: "Western actions needlessly put at risk the sustainability of peaceful space activities."

title: NASA’s Economic Benefit Reaches All 50 States
summary: NASA released the results of its second agencywide economic impact report on Thursday, demonstrating how its Moon to Mars activities, climate change research and technology, as well as other work generated more than $71.2 billion in total economic output during fiscal year 2021.

title: DIU selects startups for U.S. military weather modeling project
summary: The Defense Innovation Unit and the U.S. Air Force announced Oct. 26 they selected five companies to help build weather models using data from satellites, aerial and terrestrial sensors.

title: New Starlink dish kit enables services ‘on any moving land object’
summary: SpaceX started taking pre-orders Oct. 25 for a flat panel antenna that enables land vehicles to use its Starlink broadband service while in motion.

title: Quantum Space announces first cislunar mission
summary: Quantum Space, a company founded earlier this year to develop spacecraft platforms in cislunar space, announced plans Oct. 26 for its first smallsat pathfinder mission that will collect space situational awareness data.

title: SpaceX becomes NASA’s second-largest vendor, surpassing Boeing
summary: NASA obligated $2.04 billion to SpaceX in fiscal year 2022.

title: ISS partners weigh options for using commercial space stations
summary: Partner agencies on the International Space Station program say they are in discussions about how they will use, and pay for, commercial space stations that will replace it.
